book_level.description: Upper elementary level - humorous diary-style narrative about middle school life, social dynamics, and family

questions.question: What does Greg insist his book should be called?

options.B: A journal

questions.explanation: Greg says 'This is a journal, not a diary' even though the cover says diary.

questions.question: Who is Greg's best friend?

options.B: Fregley

questions.explanation: Rowley Jefferson is Greg's best friend, though Greg says their friendship is 'subject to change.'

questions.question: What is the name of Greg's older brother?

options.B: Roderick

questions.explanation: Roderick is Greg's older brother who plays drums in a heavy metal band.

questions.question: What is the name of Roderick's band?

options.B: Loaded Diaper

questions.explanation: Roderick's band is called Loaded Diaper, spelled L-O-D-E-D-D-I-P-E-R on his van.

questions.question: What nickname does Manny call Greg?

options.B: Bubby

questions.explanation: Manny calls Greg 'Bubby' because he couldn't pronounce 'brother' when he was a baby.

questions.question: Who started the Cheese Touch at school?

options.B: Rowley Jefferson

questions.explanation: Darren Walsh touched the moldy cheese with his finger, starting the Cheese Touch.

questions.question: How can you protect yourself from the Cheese Touch?

options.B: Cross your fingers

questions.explanation: The only way to protect yourself from the Cheese Touch is to cross your fingers.

questions.question: Who is the most popular boy in Greg's grade?

options.B: Rowley Jefferson

questions.explanation: Bryce Anderson is the most popular boy in Greg's grade.

questions.question: What position does Greg run for in student government?

options.B: Vice President

questions.explanation: Greg runs for treasurer because he figures nobody cares about that position.

questions.question: What is Greg's favorite holiday?

options.B: Thanksgiving

questions.explanation: Halloween is Greg's favorite holiday.

questions.question: What does Fregley say when he needs to go to the bathroom?

options.B: Juice! Juice!

questions.explanation: Fregley says 'Juice! Juice!' when he needs the bathroom, and the teachers keep bringing him juice.

questions.question: What book means you're in the easy reading group?

options.B: Bink Says Boo

questions.explanation: If students get 'Bink Says Boo,' they're in the easy group.

questions.question: What did Greg's dad hide in on Halloween night?

options.B: The bushes

questions.explanation: Dad hides in the bushes with a big trash can full of water to drench teenagers.

questions.question: Who took the Cheese Touch to California?

options.B: Abe Hall

questions.explanation: Abe Hall got the Cheese Touch and moved away to California, taking it with him.

questions.question: What grade did Greg get in handwriting?

options.B: B

questions.explanation: Greg got a D in handwriting because he taped his fingers together to stay crossed.

questions.question: Where does Fregley live?

options.B: Next to Rowley
options.C: Halfway between Greg's and Rowley's houses

questions.explanation: Fregley lives halfway between Greg's house and Rowley's house.

questions.question: What sport determined popularity in elementary school?

options.B: Football

questions.explanation: In elementary school, if you were the fastest runner, you got all the girls.

questions.question: What does Greg's mom always say about him?

options.B: He's smart but doesn't apply himself

questions.explanation: Mom always says Greg is a smart kid but just doesn't apply himself.

questions.question: What video game does Rowley have that Greg always plays?

options.B: Formula One Racing

questions.explanation: Greg plays Formula One Racing at Rowley's because violent games aren't allowed there.

questions.question: What did the first kid pay to enter Greg's haunted house?

options.B: 1 dollar

questions.explanation: Greg charged 2 dollars even though the flyer said 50 cents, calling it a typo.

questions.question: According to Greg, in middle school you have to be careful where you sit on the first day because ---.

options.A: the popular kids take all the good seats
options.B: the teacher assigns permanent seats based on where you sit
options.C: the windows are too bright in some areas
options.D: the teachers don't let you move at all

questions.explanation: Greg warns that wherever you sit on the first day becomes your permanent seat for the year.

questions.question: Roderick tricked Greg at the beginning of summer by ---.

options.A: hiding his video games in the basement
options.B: making him think he slept through the whole summer
options.D: pretending their parents went on vacation

questions.explanation: Roderick woke Greg up at 3 AM, dressed in school clothes, and made him think it was the first day of school.

questions.question: Greg taped his fingers together because ---.

options.A: he broke his finger playing sports
options.B: he wanted to keep them crossed to avoid the Cheese Touch
options.C: it was a trend at school

questions.explanation: Greg taped his fingers together so they'd stay crossed all the time to protect from the Cheese Touch.

questions.question: Greg was disappointed to be in the gifted reading group because ---.

options.A: his friends were in the easy group
options.B: it meant a lot of extra work

questions.explanation: Greg was disappointed because being in the gifted group just means a lot of extra work.

questions.question: When Greg plays Formula One Racing with Rowley, he wins easily by ---.

options.B: naming his car something ridiculous like 'Bad Fart'

questions.explanation: Greg names his car something ridiculous, and Rowley falls to pieces when the announcer says it.

questions.question: Rowley got in trouble with Greg because on the first day of school, he asked Greg to ---.

options.B: come over to 'play' instead of 'hang out'
options.C: sit next to him in class

questions.explanation: Rowley asked to 'play' instead of 'hang out,' which embarrassed Greg in middle school.

questions.question: Mrs. Craig confiscated the CD player and lectured the boys because she thought ---.

options.A: they stole it from another student
options.B: rock and roll music is evil and ruins brains

questions.explanation: Mrs. Craig lectured them about how rock and roll is evil and will ruin their brains.

questions.question: Greg got in trouble for listening to Roderick's CD because ---.

options.A: he played it too late at night
options.B: the headphones weren't plugged in and music came through the speakers
options.D: Mom found the CD in his room

questions.explanation: Greg didn't have the headphones plugged into the stereo, so the music came through the speakers.

questions.question: Roderick had to answer Mom's questions as punishment because ---.

options.A: he failed a test at school
options.B: Manny brought his heavy metal magazine to daycare

questions.explanation: Manny took Roderick's magazine with a woman in a bikini to daycare for show and tell.

questions.question: Greg's campaign posters were taken down by the vice principal because ---.

options.B: they contained fabrications about the other candidate
options.C: they were hung in the wrong place

questions.explanation: Mr. Roy said you weren't allowed to write fabrications about other candidates.

questions.question: At the Crossland haunted house, Mom made the chainsaw guy stop chasing the boys by ---.

options.B: telling him 'That's not nice'

questions.explanation: Mom stepped in and said 'That's not nice,' and the chainsaw guy apologized and showed them the exit.

questions.question: Greg and Rowley's haunted house had to close because ---.

options.B: Shane Snella wouldn't come out from under the bed and Rowley's dad found them

questions.explanation: Shane curled up under the bed in fear, and when Rowley's dad came down, he shut down the operation.

questions.question: When Rowley was grounded from TV, Greg tried to help by ---.

options.A: sneaking a TV into Rowley's room
options.B: doing a play-by-play of the show over the phone

questions.explanation: Greg turned on Rowley's favorite show and did a play-by-play over the phone.

questions.question: Greg thinks Dad would dismantle his game system, but he can't because ---.

options.B: the people who make them make them parent-proof

questions.explanation: Greg says the people who make game systems make them parent-proof.

questions.question: Greg ranks himself around 52nd or 53rd in popularity, but expects to move up because ---.

options.B: Charlie Davies above him is getting braces

questions.explanation: Greg figures he'll move up because Charlie Davies is getting braces next week.

questions.question: The game Greg invented with the CD player headphones involved ---.

options.A: listening to music and guessing the song
options.B: putting headphones on and shaking them off without using hands

questions.explanation: The game was to put headphones on and shake them off in the shortest time without using hands.

questions.question: Greg learned from Roderick to set people's expectations low so that ---.

options.B: you end up surprising them by practically doing nothing
options.D: you don't have to do homework

questions.explanation: Greg learned to set expectations low so you end up surprising people by practically doing nothing.

questions.question: When Greg messes up in front of Dad, the best time to do it is when Dad is ---.

options.B: reading the paper

questions.explanation: Good time to screw up is when Dad is reading the paper; bad time is when he's laying bricks.

questions.question: Greg sneaks violent video games to Rowley's house by ---.

options.B: putting his disc in Manny's 'Discovering the Alphabet' case

questions.explanation: Greg puts his game disc in Manny's Discovering the Alphabet case to get past Rowley's dad.

questions.question: After running through the neighbor's sprinkler, Greg's trick backfired because ---.

options.B: Mom made him take a shower

questions.explanation: The trick worked on Dad, but Mom saw him and made him go upstairs and take a shower.

questions.question: Why does Greg say writing in the journal will 'come in handy' when he's rich and famous?

options.A: He can sell it for money
options.B: He won't have to answer people's stupid questions
options.C: It will help him remember his childhood
options.D: His fans will want to read it

questions.explanation: Greg says when he's rich and famous, he'll have better things to do than answer questions, so the book will come in handy.

questions.question: What does Greg's attitude toward Rowley reveal about his character?

options.A: He is a loyal and supportive friend
options.B: He sees friendship partly as a way to benefit himself
options.D: He values Rowley above everyone else

questions.explanation: Greg uses Rowley for pranks, criticizes his popularity rank, and says their friendship is 'subject to change.'

questions.question: Why is it ironic that Greg was disappointed to be in the gifted reading group?

options.B: He tried to act stupid to get in the easy group but his mom intervened
options.C: The gifted group has less homework
options.D: Rowley is in the gifted group too

questions.explanation: Greg deliberately tried to act stupid during screening, but his mom is tight with the principal and probably got him placed in gifted anyway.

questions.question: What does the Cheese Touch represent in the social world of Greg's school?

options.B: How quickly social status can change through arbitrary rules
options.D: A way to make new friends

questions.explanation: The Cheese Touch shows how arbitrary social rules can instantly make someone an outcast, like Abe Hall who nobody would go near.

questions.question: What does Greg's description of middle school mixing kids who 'haven't hit their growth spurt with gorillas who shave twice a day' suggest?

options.A: He thinks the school should separate grades differently
options.B: He's commenting on the unfair physical differences that affect social dynamics

questions.explanation: Greg points out how unfair it is that physical development differences create bullying problems in middle school.

questions.question: Why does Greg think Dad 'doesn't understand the concept of Halloween'?

options.B: Dad uses Halloween to drench teenagers instead of giving out candy

questions.explanation: While other parents hand out candy, Dad hides in the bushes to drench teenagers with water.

questions.question: What does the contrast between Mom's and Dad's punishment styles reveal?

options.B: Dad reacts immediately but cools off, while Mom waits and catches you off guard
options.D: Neither parent is effective at discipline

questions.explanation: Dad gets mad but cools off quick; Mom takes days to decide, making you do nice things, then surprises you with punishment.

questions.question: Why is it significant that Bryce Anderson used to say 'girls are stinky poos' but is now the most popular boy?

options.A: It shows girls have bad memories
options.B: It shows popularity rules change unfairly between elementary and middle school
options.C: It proves being mean makes you popular

questions.explanation: Greg points out how popularity used to be about being fast, but now it's about looks and money - and he doesn't get credit for always liking girls.

questions.question: What does Greg's haunted house scheme reveal about his entrepreneurial thinking?

options.A: He's very creative but doesn't follow through on plans
options.B: He's honest in business dealings
options.D: He has no interest in money

questions.explanation: Greg had elaborate plans (sharks, acid lakes) but only finished the Hall of Screams and a ketchup pool, showing big ideas but poor execution.

questions.question: Why does Greg describe Rowley's 'How to Make Friends' book gimmicks as 'dumb' but still become his friend?

options.A: The gimmicks actually worked on Greg
options.B: Greg felt sorry for Rowley and saw him as someone he could use
options.C: Rowley's mom made them be friends

questions.explanation: Greg says he 'felt sorry for Rowley' and decided to 'take him under my wing' - and that it's great because he can use Roderick's tricks on him.

questions.question: What does Greg's claim that he's 'super good at video games' and could 'beat anyone' reveal about his self-image?

options.A: He's very humble about his abilities
options.B: He overestimates himself and values skills adults don't appreciate

questions.explanation: Greg thinks highly of his gaming skills despite Dad not appreciating them, showing he values things differently than adults.

questions.question: Why is Mom dancing to Roderick's heavy metal music ironic?

options.B: She treats all music the same, not understanding heavy metal is meant to be rebellious
options.C: She used to be in a band

questions.explanation: Mom doesn't understand that heavy metal is supposed to be rebellious - to her 'all music is the same,' which bugs Roderick.

questions.question: What does Greg's campaign poster strategy reveal about his approach to competition?

options.A: He focuses on his own strengths
options.B: He tries to win by tearing down opponents rather than promoting himself

questions.explanation: Greg's posters attacked Marty Porter (head lice, dropping money) instead of promoting his own qualifications.

questions.question: What theme does the story of Ronnie McCoy illustrate about growing up?

options.B: What makes you popular as a child doesn't guarantee success later
options.C: Running is the most important skill
options.D: Elementary school is harder than middle school

questions.explanation: Ronnie was popular in elementary school for being fast, but now kids like him are 'scratching their heads wondering what happened.'

questions.question: Why does Greg compare being stuck with Manny's potty routine to losing his appetite?

options.B: Having to scrape cereal from a toilet-like object is disgusting even if sanitary

questions.explanation: Greg says if Mom had to scrape cornflakes out of a plastic potty every morning, she wouldn't have much appetite either.

questions.question: What does Greg's numerical ranking of popularity (52nd or 53rd) suggest about middle school social dynamics?

options.B: Greg obsessively measures and calculates social status like a competition

questions.explanation: Greg treats popularity like a precise ranking system, even tracking when he might move up a spot due to someone's braces.

questions.question: Why does Rowley's crying about 'rock and roll ruining his brains' frustrate Greg?

options.B: Rowley takes things literally and doesn't understand when adults are overreacting

questions.explanation: Greg says 'sometimes I don't know about that boy' - Rowley believed Mrs. Craig's exaggeration literally.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'Let's you and me have a talk, friend' reveal about Dad's communication style?

options.A: Dad is always friendly when angry
options.B: Dad uses 'friend' sarcastically to signal Greg is in trouble
options.C: Dad wants to have a casual conversation

questions.explanation: Greg learned that when Dad says 'friend' that way, 'you know you're in trouble' - it's sarcasm.

questions.question: What does Greg raising the haunted house price from 50 cents to 2 dollars reveal about him?

options.B: He's opportunistic and willing to deceive customers for profit
options.D: He didn't want anyone to come

questions.explanation: Greg saw a 'chance to make a killing' and lied that the 50 cent price was a typo, showing opportunism.

questions.question: What is the overall message about Greg's view of himself versus how others might see him?

options.A: Greg is exactly as cool as he thinks he is
options.B: Greg sees himself as smarter and more deserving than his situation reflects

questions.explanation: Greg believes he'll be 'rich and famous,' ranks his popularity precisely, and thinks he's super skilled at games - but his schemes often fail and he's stuck in middle school like everyone else.
